title: Git Skill
description: Create a skill that forces us to use Git in all projects.  We should initialize a repo and commit changes.  Issues in BD or Github issues should be how we task work.  Feature branches should be made for the implemented efforts and merged.  We should use Conventional Commits for commits.  We should use semver for versioning.  We should keep a .worklog directory which makes a markdown file for each effort made by the agent, the date and time, and other relevant context information in case we need to recover work or investigate changes.
design: Research this for best practices using Claude Code so as not to lose work and to keep track of things to easily fix or recover
acceptance_criteria: A readme is created an a demonstration is performed by the agent and then by the human that an issue can be made using bd, worked on, committed, merged, and the worklog updated.  The issue can be trivial to prove the point.  Once the agent can do it a human test should happen.  Create a uat-<name of concept>.md file with instructions for the user to follow.  We should add a skill like /uat approve and /uat deny likely with feature or concept names so that Claude can know that a feature is full done or not.  If a feature is not done then we should build a work flow to finish it so we can follow this structure.
close_reason: UAT approved by human (TAP @ 2:46pm). Git workflow skill, UAT mechanism, and worklog system implemented.
